abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Fisheries Resource
            Management and Conservation Project is to strengthen
            fisheries sector governance and improve the quality of
            marine fish that are marketed and sold. This restructuring
            is in response to a request received from the Government of
            Yemen (GoY) dated March 14, 2012, and a request for partial
            cancellation in the Aide Memoire dated June 5, 2012. The
            restructuring is within the broader context of the
            Bank's renewed engagement in Yemen and follows a
            sustained period of civil unrest; a deteriorating political
            and security situation, and the resulting suspension of
            disbursement across the Yemen portfolio from July 28, 2011
            to January 20, 2012.  The closing date requires an extension
            of 15 months in order to compensate for additional delays
            resulting from the recent socio-political unrest in the
            country since early 2011, and the ensuing Bank suspension of
            disbursements. Extension of the closing date will enable
            both the completion of key civil works including
            rehabilitation of fisheries ports and construction of access
            roads, and the undertaking of training for target
            stakeholders on their roles and responsibilities relating to
            fisheries resource management and conservation. The borrower
            has notified the Bank of a partial cancellation of credit
            proceeds. Balance funds after cancellation will be
            reallocated among project categories. The results framework
            and monitoring have been revised to accurately reflect
            changes needed to enhance the monitoring indicators and
            corresponding end-of-project target values, in line with the
            stated project development objectives that will remain
            unchanged and the new closing date.
